entities.description: "The New York Times Company is the publisher of the newspaper, providing news and articles on various topics."
"Rebecca R. Ruiz is one of the authors of the article discussing the perils of betting and its oversight."
"Kenneth P. Vogel is one of the authors of the article discussing the perils of betting and its oversight."
"Joe Drape is one of the authors of the article discussing the perils of betting and its oversight."
"David Hummel is an individual who lost more than $30,000 due to sports betting, starting with a 'risk-free' bet."
"FanDuel is a gambling company that offered a 'risk-free' bet to David Hummel, leading to significant losses."
"The Supreme Court is responsible for opening the door to widespread sports betting in 2018."
"Bratstvo battalion is a volunteer Ukrainian special forces team conducting secret raids and special operations against Russian forces."
"Oleksiy Serediuk is the battalion commander of the Bratstvo battalion, leading dangerous missions."
"Dnipro River is a strategic waterway that bisects Ukraine and has become the dividing line of the southern front."
"Kherson is a city in Ukraine that was recaptured by Ukrainian forces, holding the western bank of the Dnipro River."
"Kyiv is one of the cities where the Bratstvo battalion conducted operations, including forward spotting and sabotage."
"Kharkiv is another city where the Bratstvo battalion conducted operations, including forward spotting and sabotage."
"Gareth Bale is a player for Wales who scored a penalty kick, resulting in a 1-1 final score."
Richard M. Fierro, also known as Mr. Fierro, is a person who engaged in heroic actions during the shooting incident, pulling a friend down with him and later tackling the gunman.
"Anderson Lee Aldrich is the suspected gunman held on charges of murder and bias-motivated crime causing bodily injury."
"Russian troops are the opposing force in Ukraine, retreating to the eastern bank of the Dnipro River."
"The United States is mentioned in the context of the World Cup and a veteran's actions in Colorado."
"Colorado is the location where Richard M. Fierro stopped a gunman at Club Q."
"Club Q is the nightclub in Colorado Springs where a shooting occurred and was stopped by Richard M. Fierro."
"John Suthers is the Mayor of Colorado Springs, who commented on Richard M. Fierro's heroic actions."
"Wales is the national team represented by Gareth Bale in the World Cup."
"The World Cup is the event where Gareth Bale scored a penalty kick for Wales, resulting in a 1-1 final score."
"The event refers to the U.S. team's performance in the World Cup, mentioned in the article."
"'Combat Mode' refers to the event where Richard M. Fierro used his combat instincts to stop a gunman at Club Q."

relationships.description: "Rebecca R. Ruiz is an author contributing to The New York Times Company's article on betting perils."
"Kenneth P. Vogel is an author contributing to The New York Times Company's article on betting perils."
"Joe Drape is an author contributing to The New York Times Company's article on betting perils."

"The Bratstvo battalion crosses the Dnipro River for operations against Russian forces."

"Mayor John Suthers of Colorado Springs praised Richard M. Fierro for his heroic actions."

entities.description: "Yale Law is an educational institution where Stewart Rhodes studied law."
"Stewart Rhodes is a person who attended Yale Law School and later started a far-right militia called Oath Keepers."
"Oath Keepers is a far-right militia founded by Stewart Rhodes."
"The Biden administration is involved in brokering a tentative deal to prevent a rail strike."
"Al Shabab is a militant group causing havoc and contributing to a catastrophe due to the worst drought in 40 years."
"Indonesia is a geographical location where an earthquake occurred, resulting in significant loss of life and damage."
"Java is a geographical location in Indonesia where an earthquake led to the death of at least 162 people and potential trapping of many others."
"The Manhattan district attorney’s office is investigating the former president's role in a hushmoney payment to a porn star."
"Trump is the former president who is under investigation by the Manhattan district attorney’s office for his role in a hushmoney payment."
"Christie’s is an auction house that pulled the sale of a T. rex named Shen after questions about its authenticity."
"Shen is a T. rex specimen whose sale was pulled by Christie’s due to authenticity concerns."
"Greenwich Village is a geographical location with historical significance, including landmarks like the Stonewall Inn and Julius’ bar."
"Stonewall Inn is a landmark in Greenwich Village, known for its historical significance in the gay rights movement."
"Julius’ bar is another landmark in Greenwich Village, significant in the context of gay history."
"Taiwan is a geographical location experiencing a flight of engineers to China due to financial incentives and new opportunities."
"China is a geographical location attracting engineers from Taiwan for its semiconductor plants, but harsh pandemic protocols and a tech cold war are changing this dynamic."
"The Freight Rail Conductors Union is a labor organization primarily representing freight rail conductors, which voted down a tentative deal."
"Scores Die in Indonesia Quake is an event where an earthquake in Indonesia resulted in the death of many people."
"Prosecutors Move on Trump is an event where the Manhattan district attorney’s office has intensified its investigation into the former president's role in a hushmoney payment."
"Whose Bones Are These? is an event concerning the questioning of the authenticity of a T. rex named Shen, leading Christie’s to pull its sale."
"Telling Himself ‘Yes’ is an event where actor Jeremy Pope discusses his experiences with shame and self-acceptance in relation to the gay military film 'The Inspection'."
"A Walk Through History is an event, an architectural tour of Greenwich Village, that stops at gay landmarks like the Stonewall Inn and Julius’ bar."
"Jeremy Pope is a star of the gay military film 'The Inspection', discussing themes of shame and self-acceptance."
"A farm sanctuary in New York is an organization involved in efforts to learn about the inner lives of various animals."
"Sasha Prasad-Shreckengast is an individual associated with a farm sanctuary in New York, involved in learning about the inner lives of animals."
"Hayes the steer is an animal at a farm sanctuary in New York, where efforts are being made to understand the inner lives of various animals."

entities.description: "Anderson Lee Aldrich is the suspected gunman in a shooting incident, held on suspicion of five counts of murder and five counts of bias-motivated crime causing bodily injury."

"Kelly Loving is one of the victims identified in the shooting incident."
"Ashley Paugh is one of the victims identified in the shooting incident."
"Derrick Rump is one of the victims identified in the shooting incident."
Raymond Green Vance, also known as Mr. Green Vance, is one of the victims identified in the shooting incident and was the longtime boyfriend of Mr. Fierro's daughter.
"Chief Adrian Vasquez is the Chief of the Colorado Springs Police Department who identified the victims of the shooting."
"Colorado Springs Police Department is the law enforcement agency that identified the victims and is involved in the case of the shooting incident."
Richard M. Fierro, also known as Mr. Fierro, is a person who engaged in heroic actions during the shooting incident, pulling a friend down with him and later tackling the gunman.
"Colorado is the geographical location where the shooting incident took place."
"The shooting incident is the event where five people were killed and several others injured by the suspected gunman, Anderson Lee Aldrich."
"Mr. Fierro's daughter was injured in the shooting incident and is recovering at home, and her longtime boyfriend was Raymond Green Vance."
"New York City's welfare agency, the Administration for Children’s Services, is accused of racial bias against Black families."
"The Administration for Children’s Services is the welfare agency in New York City that has been accused of bias against Black families."
"Andy Newman is the author of the article discussing the racial bias in New York City's welfare agency."
"Javier C. Hernández is the author of the article about the New York Philharmonic where women now outnumber men for the first time."
"The New York Philharmonic is an orchestra where women now outnumber men for the first time in its 180-year history."
"David Geffen Hall is the newly renovated home of the New York Philharmonic at Lincoln Center."
"Lincoln Center is the location where the New York Philharmonic moved in 1962 and where its newly renovated home, David Geffen Hall, is situated."
"Cynthia Phelps is the principal viola of the New York Philharmonic, who commented on the milestone of women outnumbering men in the orchestra."

"James B. Stewart is one of the authors of the article discussing Disney's chief executive, Bob Chapek."

"Disney is the company led by Bob Chapek, which reported stellar quarterly earnings and passed Netflix for the first time in streaming subscriptions."
"Jim Cramer is the CNBC host who expressed bullish sentiments about Disney's future in October."
"Avatar: The Way of Water is a coming blockbuster pitched by Bob Chapek for Disney's future lineup."
